clinical_study.brief_title: Quantitative Evaluation of the Progression of Liver Disease, Using ShearWaveTM
clinical_study.official_title: Quantitative Evaluation of Liver and Kidney Disease With Liver and Kidney Elastography Measurements in Liver Transplant Recipients Using the Supersonic Imagine Aixplorer ShearWaveTM Elastography Ultrasound Machine

brief_summary.textblock: Liver biopsy for the assessment of fibrosis has multiple limitations. Liver ShearWaveTM Elastography may provide a non-invasive, fast, and reproducible alternative for the quantitative assessment of liver fibrosis.

detailed_description.textblock:
To obtain a quantitative evaluation of the progression of liver disease, using ShearWaveTM Elastography measurements obtained with the Supersonic Imagine Aixplorer ultrasound machine.
To compare the glomerular filtration rate and the quantitative evaluation of the progression of renal disease, using ShearWaveTM Elastography measurements obtained with the Supersonic Imagine Aixplorer ultrasound machine in post-liver transplantation patients.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.description: Patients will have a scan performed at thier regularly scheduled clinic visits.

study_pop.textblock: participants will be from Liver Consultants of Texas patient population

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males and Females over the age of 18
- Patients of LCOT Dallas office, with chronic liver disease
- Liver Transplant Recipients
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any person unable to provide an informed consent
- Any female who is pregnant or thinks she might be pregnant
